children.name: Beginning Programming in Python (CSE 20)
children.size: learn data types, control flow, functions, data structures, and object-oriented programming all in Python

children.name: Programming Abstractions: Python (CSE 30)
children.size: create objects in Python with primitive operations

children.name: Comparative Languages or Functional Programming (CSE 112 or CSE 114 or CSE 116)
children.size: compare styles and design principles of several programming languages or problem solve with higher-order functions

children.name: Computer Systems and Assembly Language (CSE 12/L)
children.size: explore how computers compute in hardware and software

children.name: Computer Systems and C Programming (CSE 13S or CSE 13E)
children.size: learn and use C to control embedded computing system

children.name: Computer Architecture (CSE 120)
children.size: understand MIPS, ISA, and RISC and the evolution of CPU microarchitecture from single to multi-cycle pipelines

children.name: Principles of Computer Systems Design or Intro to Operating Systems (CSE 130 or CSE 131)
children.size: cover principles of computer-systems design and complexity, memory, synchronization, layering, etc.

children.name: Introduction to Data Structures and Algorithms (CSE 101)
children.size: learn abstract data types and data structures like linked lists, stacks/queues, hash tables, trees, and evaluate big-Oh of algorithms

children.name: Introduction to Analysis of Algorithms (CSE 102)
children.size: conduct construction and mathematical analysis of divide-and-conquer, greedy, and dynamic programming algorithms

children.name: Computational Models (CSE 103)
children.size: represent regular languages using pumping lemmas, Turing machines, and learning Church-Turing thesis, etc.

children.name: Calculus For Science, Engineering, And Mathematics (MATH 19A or MATH 20A)
children.size: calculate limits, derivatives of various functions, and apply principles to max and min problems

children.name: Calculus For Science, Engineering, And Mathematics (MATH 19B or MATH 20B)
children.size: calculate definite integrals, convergence tests, and the Taylor and Maclaurin series using the fundemental theorem of calculus

children.name: Vector Calculus (AM 30 or MATH 23A)
children.size: calculate vectors in n-dimensional Euclidean space, Taylor's theorem with several variables, etc.

children.name: Applied Discrete Mathematics (CSE 16)
children.size: understand sets, functions, predicate calculus, and mathematical proof methods like induction and contradiction

children.name: Linear Algebra (MATH 21)
children.size: compute the determinants, linear transformations, eigenvalues, and more on matrices

children.name: Probability & Statistics (CSE 107 or STAT 131)
children.size: learn stochastic analysis tools like probabilty, Bayes Theorem, Bernnoulli trials, etc.

children.name: Introduction to Computer Graphics/Lab (CSE 160/L)
children.size: modeling, rendering computer-generated imagery

children.name: Introduction to Data Mining (CSE 145)
children.size: learn techniques, algorithms, and applications like preprocessing, exploration, classification, clustering, mining text, and sequential/social data

children.name: Data Programming for Visualization (CSE 163)
children.size: create interactive web visualizations using data

children.name: Database Systems I (CSE 180)
children.size: learn concepts, approaches, tools, and methodology of database design

children.name: Database Systems II (CSE 181)
children.size: architecture and implementation of databases

children.name: Introduction to Database Management Systems (CSE 182)
children.size: explore entity-relationship, relational, XML data model, normal forms, SQL, etc.

children.name: Data Wrangling and Web Scraping (CSE 184)
children.size: data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation

children.name: Computability and Computational Complexity (CSE 104/W)
children.size: Turing machines, Chomsky hierarchy, Halting problem, NP-completeness, etc

children.name: Applied Graph Theory and Algorithms (CSE106)
children.size: explore trees, Eulerian and Hamiltonian graphs, graph transversal to solve problems in connectivity, routing, etc.

children.name: Advanced Programming (CSE 111)
children.size: introduction to object-oriented techniques including data abstraction, inheritance, polymorphism, etc.

children.name: Computer Security (CSE 132)
children.size: introduction to computer/network security like access control, security in programming languages, basic cryptography, and ecurity protocols

children.name: Artificial Intelligence (CSE 140)
children.size: machine learning, optimization problems, computational methods, etc.

children.name: Machine Learning and Data Mining (CSE 142)
children.size: machine learning algorithms and their application in online learning, boosting, nearest neighbor techniques, etc.

children.name: Introduction to Natural Language Processing (CSE 143)
children.size: programs that generate and learn natural languages

children.name: Applied Machine Learning (CSE 144)
children.size: statistical inference to various complex model networks

children.name: Fundamentals of Compiler Design I (CSE 110A)
children.size: Introduction to study of compiler implementation

children.name: Fundamentals of Compiler Design II (CSE 110B)
children.size: Advanced study of compiler implementation

children.name: Parallel Programming (CSE 113)
children.size: explore topics like types of parallel computers and programming platforms from design, implementation, to optimization, etc.

children.name: Microprocessor System Design/Lab (CSE 121/L)
children.size: microprocessor and microcontroller architecture, etc.

children.name: Introduction to VLSI Digital System Design (CSE 122)
children.size: explore very large scale integrated custom integrated circuits, learning about semiconductor manufacturing, logic families, etc.

children.name: Logic Design with Verilog (CSE 125/L)
children.size: design and verify systems with emphasis on ASIC and FPGA Verilog digital logic design

children.name: Embedded Operating Systems (CSE 134)
children.size: explore the internal design of an embedded operating systems kernel

children.name: Distributed Systems (CSE 138)
children.size: communication, naming, synchronization, etc.

children.name: Introduction to Computer Networks (CSE 150/L)
children.size: addresses issues arising in organizing communications among autonomous computers

children.name: Advanced Computer Networks (CSE 151/L)
children.size: in-depth coverage CSE 150 topics like routing, transport, internetworking, plus wireless, application-layer services, security

children.name: Network Programming/Lab (CSE 156/L)
children.size: methods & tools ex. network protocal support

children.name: Introduction to Mechatronics/Lab (ECE 118/L)
children.size: designing intelligent electro-mechanical systems

children.name: Introduction to Software Engineering (CSE 115A)
children.size: characteristics of well-engineered software systems

children.name: Software Design Project I (CSE 115B)
children.size: specify, design, construct, test, and document a complete software system in a specialized application domain

children.name: Software Design Project II (CSE 115C)
children.size: develop, test, document, and deploy substantial software project

children.name: Mobile Applications (CSE 118)
children.size: SDK, native methodologies, platform and server division, etc.

children.name: Engineering Design Project I & II (CSE 123A&B)
children.size: two-course sequence to apply research, planning, procurement, and more skills for a substantial project

children.name: Internet of Things (CSE 157)
children.size: concepts and techniques in the design of IoT like dominant architectures, protocols, wireless infrastructure, security etc.

children.name: Mobile Sensing and Interaction (CSE 167)
children.size: hands-on knowledge and experience with modern mobile computing platforms for sensing and interactions tasks

children.name: Web Applications (CSE 183)
children.size: build and design web apps

children.name: Ethics & Algorithms (CSE 146)
children.size: introduction to data-driven and algorithmic decision making and ethical frameworks for evaluating automated systems

children.name: Technical Writing and Communication in CS (CSE 185S/E)
children.size: exercise writing to engineers

children.name: Senior Thesis (CSE 195)
children.size: perform self-driven research

children.name: Game Development Experience (CMPM 120)
children.size: practice concrete programming and collaboration skills to make a digital game from start to finish

children.name: User Experience for Interactive Media (CMPM 131)
children.size: learn how to approach design problems of interactive media holistically, beyond usability and accessibility

children.name: Game AI (CMPM 146)
children.size: intro to using artificial intelligence in computer games and creating non-player characters

children.name: Game Graphics and Real-Time Rendering (CMPM 163)
children.size: understand real-time hardware-accelerated graphics programming for game development, visual effects, and interactive multimedia projects

children.name: Game Engines/Lab (CMPM 164/L)
children.size: learn graphic elements in computer games like modifying, optimizing, adding components, and building a game engine

children.name: Game Design Studio II (CMPM 171)
children.size: 2/3 sequence for designing, implementing, and testing a computer game from previous course

children.name: Game Design Studio III (CMPM 172)
children.size: 3/3 sequence for designing, implementing, and testing a computer game from previous courses

children.name: Introduction to Dynamical Systems (AM 114)
children.size: learn continuous/discrete dynamical systems with topics like fixed points, stability, limit cycles, etc.

children.name: Computational Methods and Applications (AM 147)
children.size: apply computational methods to solving mathematical problems using Matlab

children.name: Introduction to Number Theory (MATH 110)
children.size: prime numbers, unique factorization, congruences with applications, rational/irrational numbers, and continued fractions

children.name: Graph Theory (MATH 115)
children.size: Graph theory, trees, vertex and edge colorings, Hamilton cycles, Eulerian circuits, etc.

children.name: Combinatorics (MATH 116)
children.size: using induction and elementary counting techniques for counting subsets, partitions, and permutations, plus recurrence relations and generating functions, etc.

children.name: Advanced Linear Algebra (MATH 117)
children.size: review abstract vector spaces, dual spaces, bilinear forms, normal forms, introduction to tensor products and exterior algebras

children.name: Advanced Number Theory (MATH 118)
children.size: divisibility, congruences, arithmetical functions, quadratic residues, reciprocity, and forms, etc.

children.name: Cryptography (MATH 134)
children.size: introduces cryptography methods like shift, affine, Vigenere, Hill, RSA, ElGamal, and knapsack cipher

children.name: Introductory Chaos Theory/Lab (MATH 145/L)
children.size: Lorenz and Rossler attractors, measures of chaos, attractor reconstruction, and applications from the sciences

children.name: Numerical Analysis (MATH 148)
children.size: survey of the basic numerical methods which are used to solve scientific problems, including mathematical analysis and computing assignments, etc.

children.name: Mathematical Logic I (MATH 160)
children.size: Propositional/predicate calculus, completeness, compactness, Lowenheim-Skolem, recursive functions, Godel incompleteness, Hilbert's 10th problem, etc.

children.name: Mathematical Logic II (MATH 161)
children.size: Russell's paradox, cardinal and ordinal numbers/arithmetic, transfinite induction, axiom systems for set theory, etc.

children.name: Introduction To Physics I & II (PHYS 5A&B)
children.size: elementary mechanics, vectors, Newton's laws, conservation of momentum and energy, etc. & wave motion in matter, geometrical optics, etc.

children.name: Introduction To Physics I & III (PHYS 5A&C)
children.size: elementary mechanics, vectors, Newton's laws, conservation of momentum and energy, etc. & intro to electricity and magnetism, Maxwell's equation

children.name: Introductory Physics I & II (PHYS 6A&B)
children.size: elementary mechanics, vectors, Newton's laws, conservation of momentum and energy, etc. & intro to thermodynamics and wave motion in matter

children.name: Introductory Physics I & III (PHYS 6A&C)
children.size: elementary mechanics, vectors, Newton's laws, conservation of momentum and energy, etc. & intro to electricity and magnetism, elementary circuits
